New Records: Anthony Volpe hit a grand slam in Game 4, a first for a Yankees shortstop in the World Series
Key Match Events: Anthony Volpe's grand slam in the third inning gave the Yankees their first lead since the 10th inning of Game 1
The Yankees piled on with five runs in the eighth inning
The Dodgers lost the game despite Freddie Freeman's fourth home run of the series
Pre-Game Insights: Analysts predicted a close game between the two rival teams
The manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge finally got a hit, drove in a run, and went all night without a strikeout
Anthony Volpe said the win hit him, and nothing else had yet
The Yankees will turn to ace Gerrit Cole on Wednesday, and the Dodgers will counter with mid-season acquisition Jack Flaherty
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees' bullpen made up for a so-so outing by rookie starter Luis Gil (four runs in four innings)
The Dodgers acquired the rental right-hander Jack Flaherty at the trade deadline to be their guy in big games this fall
No team in World Series history has won a series after trailing 3-0
